page.title: 14Law and Order (part 1).
page.content: In the days of William I, foresters upheld the forest laws. Today Staffs. Police use mounted patrols and have on trial scramble bikes. Both are well suited to easy movement over the rough heathland and forest tracks. We interviewed two mounted policemen who told us about their horses and their work. A horse is bought for about 1500 pounds when 3 years old and training takes 12 to 18 months. It will work until it is 18 to 20 years old. The rider has a basic 9 week training course. When on duty, the rider is responsible for feeding and grooming the horse. The value of horse patrols is that a horse can move quickly and quietly. The riders have special uniforms but they did tell us that their hands and feet got cold in winter!
